answers.answer: If you normally drink coffee or soda (ie caffeine) I would try that first. But if you don't normally drink things with caffeine, I would try Tylenol. If Tylenol doesn't work call your doctor. My doctor told me to call if I had any headaches that could not be controlled by Tylenol because it could be a sign of pre-eclampsia

It may also be a good idea for your doc to check your iron levels. A lot of headaches are from the increase in blood volume, but if your iron is low it could be contributing. Another thought that has helped me is to see a chiropractor. I was nervous about this at first, but I found a great one with experience in prenatal adjustments & it has been AMAZING. I only go when I feel my back pulling or if I'm getting a lot of headaches & I found that sometimes just a simple adjustment really does the trick. But I agree- either way, you'll also want to rule out preeclampsia & anemia.
You can try to drink the Tylenol with the coffee/soda. I was told caffeine helps painkillers to work faster.
Try drinking two glasses Of blue gatorade.

Extra strength Tylenol did nothing for me :( caffeine not much help either. I tried essential oils and they worked within 5 minutes of rubbing on my temple and forehead. I used francensense or however you spell it. Also the smell of peppermint helps too.

question: I've been drinking lots of water but still suffering from annoying headaches. What's better, Tylenol or a cup of coffee?
title: Constant headaches
